A genoise sponge is
basically a Swiss roll sponge

that then has melted butter
folded through at the end.
But remember,

a Swiss roll sponge is whole
egg whisked up with sugar
until it's about three times the volume.
Then you carefully fold in the flours,
and then in genoise,
you carefully fold in the melted butter.

So you didn't need to
separate out your eggs,
you just need to put loads of volume
by whisking together whole egg and sugar.
